CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 26, 1959, pg. 1, reads: "Overcome in Fatal Fire - Mrs. Hattie Harris, 31, of 1401 Liverpool St., lies bewildered in Allegheny General Hospital this week after being overcome by smoke in her third-floor apartment where a visitor, James Banner, 32, of 1822 Charles St., fell asleep on a couch while smoking and burned to death in fire which raged through the entire apartment. She was sleeping in a rear bedroom with children at the time. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Hattie Harris lying in bed in Allegheny General Hospital, after suffering smoke inhalation in fire in her apartment at 1401 Liverpool Street, Manchester
